author: terencechain
content: Preston and I have the following concern:

author: terencechain
content: We don't use attestations that are in the blocks for fork choice

author: terencechain
content: It's likely that an attestation could be missing in its gossip domain but later showed up inside a block

author: terencechain
content: Given that, we are thinking to track which attestation is procssed, and if there's an attestation showed up in the block which we haven't seen before, we'll apply fork choice for that

author: prestonvanloon
content: yeah exactly, if we learn of an attestation we haven't seen before through a new block, why would we ignore this data for fork choice? Adding more information expands our view of the world and it doesn't make sense to ignore data because it's already been processed in a block
